alert.note: Alert for Caguas; Gurabo; Juncos; Las Piedras; San Lorenzo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 4:15PM ADT until September 18 at 10:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Caguas County in Puerto Rico... Gurabo County in Puerto Rico... Juncos County in Puerto Rico... Las Piedras County in Puerto Rico... San Lorenzo County in Puerto Rico... * Until 900 PM AST. * At 315 PM AST, Doppler radar indicates hurricane rainbands producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 10 inches of rain have fallen since midnight. Additional rainfall amounts of 4 to 6 inches are expected before 9 PM AST in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of mainstem rivers such as Rio Caguitas, Rio Valenciano, and Rio Canas, also small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low- lying areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Strong winds can knock branches off trees with deadly effect, avoid traveling if at all possible.

area.areaDesc: Caguas; Gurabo; Juncos; Las Piedras; San Lorenzo
